whether, for purposes of definition of 'previous representation' in evidence act , earlier interlocutory proceedings were same proceedings as the trial within meaning of 'the proceeding in which evidence of the representation is sought to be adduced' held: each representation was made with client's authority and constituted an 'admission'

'the proceeding' in evidence act definition of 'previous representation' is the particular hearing before the particular judge and does not extend to other hearings or phases in the conduct of a matter, including any interlocutory proceeding, in which the parties have been engaged prior to that hearing
